<font size="+3"><b>Public Scholarship</b></font>


Public scholarship improves academic research, generates public interest in our work, and communicates the substantive importance of our research to policymakers and voters. I have had the privilege to share my research and expertise with a variety of public-facing media outlets. My research has been featured in <i>The New York Times</i>, <i>The Sacramento Bee</i>, <i>Roll Call</i>, <i>Salon</i>, <i>La Tercera</i>, <i>Pacific Standard</i>, <i>Democratic Audit</i>, <i>RAISE the Vote</i>, and <i>The California Aggie</i>. I have also appeared on <i>ABC10</i> television news in Sacramento, the <i>Communication Matters</i> podcast, and <i>The News Cycle</i> podcast to discuss state and national politics as a UC Davis political scientist. <br><br>
